name: Applegate Park
description: Come play pickleball at Applegate Park in Merced, CA! There are 4 outdoor hard courts. The lines are permanent, but you'll need to bring your own net. The facility includes amenities like restrooms, water, lights, and trainers or lessons. The courts cannot be reserved. The courts are free.

name: Cresthills Park
description: Come play pickleball at Cresthills Park in Los Banos, CA! There are 3 outdoor courts. The lines are permanent, but you'll need to bring your own net. The courts are free.

name: In Shape Yosemite Avenue health Club Merced
description: Come play pickleball at In Shape Yosemite Avenue health Club Merced in Merced, CA! There are 12 outdoor hard courts. These are dedicated courts with permanent lines and nets. Amenities include lights and restrooms. You can reserve the courts. A membership is required to play.

name: Los Banos Community Center
description: Los Banos Community Center is one of the most popular places to play pickleball in Los Banos, CA. There are 2 indoor courts. The lines are permanent, but you'll need to bring your own net. The courts are free. Players have access to restrooms and water.

name: Los Banos Fitness and Racquet Club
description: Los Banos Fitness and Racquet Club is one of the most popular places to play pickleball in Los Banos, CA. There are 12 outdoor hard courts. These are dedicated courts with permanent lines and nets. Players have access to food, restrooms, water, and lights. A one-time fee is required to play.

name: McCombs Gym, Merced County
description: McCombs Gym, Merced County is one of the most popular places to play pickleball in Merced, CA. There are 4 indoor hard courts. The lines are permanent, and portable nets are available. Amenities include restrooms, water, lights, wheelchair accessibility, and trainers or lessons. A one-time fee is required to play.

name: San Luis High School
description: San Luis High School is a place to play pickleball in Los Banos, CA. There are 2 indoor asphalt courts. The lines are permanent, but you'll need to bring your own net. The courts are free. Players have access to restrooms.
